news.title: OpenAI is coming for those sweet enterprise dollars in 2026
news.summary: OpenAI has reportedly appointed Barret Zoph to lead its push into enterprise just a week after Zoph rejoined the company.

news.title: Vimeo starts layoffs after acquisition by Bending Spoons
news.summary: Vimeo is in the process of laying off some of its global staff after being acquired last year by Bending Spoons for $1.38B.

news.title: GM to end Chevy Bolt EV production next year, move China-made Buick to US factory
news.summary: The factory musical chairs reflect an economic and political environment, shaped by the Trump administration's tariff policy and its decision to end the federal EV tax credit.

news.title: Capital One acquires Brex for steep discount to its peak valuation, but early believers are laughing all the way to the bank
news.summary: Before everyone sharpens their knives, consider that for the VCs who backed Brex at its outset, the sale is a triumph.

news.title: Voice AI engine and OpenAI partner LiveKit hits $1B valuation
news.summary: The five-year-old-startup powers OpenAI’s ChatGPT voice mode and raised a $100 million round led by Index Ventures.

news.title: Ring can verify videos now, but that might not help you with most AI fakes
news.summary: Ring has launched a new Ring Verify tool that the company says can "verify that Ring videos you receive haven't been edited or changed." news.title: Samsung’s smallest Frame TVs have fallen to their lowest prices to date
news.summary: Unless you’re dead set on picking up a larger panel, Samsung’s forthcoming 2026 Frame lineup represents a fairly minor upgrade. news.title: Nintendo is following up Alarmo with a weird Talking Flower in March
news.summary: After sharing a brief look at its new Talking Flower during a Nintendo Direct showcase last September that generated more questions than answers, Nintendo has finally revealed more details about what the interactive toy actually does and how much it costs. news.summary: Vimeo is laying off employees around the globe just months after the Italian software company Bending Spoons acquired the platform for $1.38 billion, as reported earlier by Business Insider. news.title: US officially out of WHO, leaving hundreds of millions of dollars unpaid
news.summary: US did not pay $278 million in 2024–2025 dues and millions more in promised funds.

news.title: Overrun with AI slop, cURL scraps bug bounties to ensure "intact mental health"
news.summary: The onslaught includes LLMs finding bogus vulnerabilities and code that won't compile.

news.summary: Crypto theft was "the worst thing I had ever done."

news.title: Sorry MAGA, Turns Out People Still Like ‘Woke’ Art
news.summary: From Black vampires gobbling up Oscar nominations to gay pro hockey players dominating the culture, diverse stories broke through in an environment that’s increasingly hostile to them.

news.title: Legislators Push to Make Companies Tell Customers When Their Products Will Die
news.summary: A pair of bills in Massachusetts would require manufacturers to tell consumers when their connected gadgets are going dark. It should be a boon for cybersecurity as connected devices grow obsolete.

news.title: Elon Musk Sure Made Lots of Predictions at Davos
news.summary: Humanoid robots, space travel, the science of aging—Musk weighed in on all of it at this week’s World Economic Forum. But his predictions rarely work out the way he says they will.

news.title: What Happens When a Chinese Battery Factory Comes to Town
news.summary: Chinese firms are building battery plants from Europe to North America, promising jobs while prompting local concerns about the environment, politics, and who really benefits.

news.title: The 28 Best Movies on Apple TV, WIRED’s Picks (January 2026)
news.summary: F1: The Movie, CODA, and Highest 2 Lowest are just a few of the movies you should be watching on Apple TV this month.
